summary: the 5′ two-thirds of the genome encodes large polyprotein precursors, open reading frame (ORF) 1 and ORF1b, which are proteolytically cleaved to generate 16 non-structural proteins. the 3′ one-third of the genome encodes four structural proteins, spike (S), envelope (E), matrix (M) and nucleocapsid (N) recognition of virus infection plays an important role in limiting virus replication at the early stages of infection. four models describing activation of the NLRP3 inflammasome have been proposed thus far. cathepsin B and L, which are specific lysosomal cysteine proteases, play a role after phagocytosis of cholesterol crystals. avage products generated by RNase L activate the NLRP3 inflammasome via the DExD/H-box helicase, DHX33. these molecules then recruit the speck-like protein containing a caspase recruitment domain (ASC) and pro-caspase-1 to form the NLRP3 inflammasome. this event activates the downstream molecule, caspase-1, which catalyzes proteolytic processing of pro-IL-1 and pro the role of the 3a protein in activating the NLRP3 inflammasome remains unknown. cells and Viruses Bone marrow-derived macrophages were prepared as described previously. influenza NLRP3 inflammasome was redistributed to the perinuclear region. cells expressing the ion channel activity-loss mutants 3a-CS or V25F uniformly expressed NLRP3 throughout the cytoplasm. these data provide evidence that the ion channel activity of the SARS-CoV 3a protein is essential. IL-1 secretion caused by influenza virus was completely blocked when the extracellular K+ concentration was increased to 130 mM. the inhibitory effect of the K+-rich medium was also observed when cells were stimulated with lentiviruses expressing the SARS-CoV E or 3a proteins. BMMs were infected with influenza virus A/PR8 (A) or lentiviruses expressing SARS-CoV 3a or E proteins (B) and cultured in the presence or absence of KCl. cell-free supernatants were collected at 24 h post-infection, and analyzed for IL-1 by ELISA. hepatitis C virus stimulates NLRP3 inflammasome-mediated IL-1 production. viroporins encoded by RNA viruses activate NLRP3 inflammasome. hepatitis C virus stimulates IL-1 production through its p7 viroporin. a recent study has shown that the 3a protein of EV71 directly interacts with NLRP3 to facilitate the assembly of NLRP3 inflammasome complex. in the case of SARS-CoV, the viroporin E forms forms Ca2+-permeable ion channels and activates the NLRP3 inflammasome. another viroporin 3a was found to induce NLRP3 inflammasome activation. a better understanding of the mechanism that governs the NLRP3 inflammasome will facilitate the development of more effective interventions for the treatment of infectious diseases. authors say the research was conducted in the absence of any commercial or financial relationships that could be construed as a potential conflict of interest.
